subhead: The city authorities have scaled back Christian holiday festivities since October 7, 2023, attack. Celebrations have now resumed, against a backdrop of economic catastrophe and Israeli settlement expansion across the West Bank.

subhead: Torn between strong performances and a tense atmosphere, the French biathletes faced an important test during the Grand-Bornand World Cup stage, as they prepare for the Milan-Cortina Olympic Games, to be held from February 6 to 22, 2026.

title: In Turkey, the fall of a star television presenter exposes internal power struggles
subhead: The influential television host, Mehmet Akif Ersoy, has been arrested as part of a drug trafficking investigation and placed in provisional detention.

title: 'Taylor Swift: The End of an Era' on Disney+: Behind the scenes of a record-breaking tour
subhead: Across six episodes, the documentary series takes viewers behind the scenes of 'The Eras Tour,' revealing the key moments and events that shaped the phenomenon that was 'The Eras Tour'.

title: Why more young people are turning to religion
subhead: Many researchers have observed a resurgence of religious commitment among young people in France, often accompanied by a certain rigorism. This renewed spiritual quest is linked both to the anxieties of our era and, at times, a search for identity.

subhead: Long considered unpopular by the French, musicals have flourished recently in the capital. But is this just a mere trend to which the French will inevitably turn their noses up?

title: Anthropologist Anton Serdeczny: 'The magic of Christmas is a time when the worlds of the living and the dead open up to one another'
subhead: In a fascinating investigation into the Yule log, the historian developed an innovative approach to the magical dimension that has been attributed for millennia to the night of December 24, which he revisited in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Celebrate the season with Le Monde in English's most beloved holiday movies
